In this meta being a champion that isn't safe and can't clear waves effectively usually means that you're a free kill and your tower dies within the first 10 minutes of the game. We'll probably use Grounded on other abilities at some point assuming it continues to test well on Cass. Grounded's a debuff that presents the use of dashes/jumps/blinks for anyone unfamiliar with the term and we've been trying it out on the Cass gameplay update currently underway. 

I wouldn't want to add it to Viktor's Gravity Field without making additional changes though. Gravity Field's currently a slow, that turns into a stun, that once upgraded also vacuums. Ability to Flash, dash etc out of it's pretty important counterplay given the impact of the payoff there. The thematic fit's really cool, wouldn't consider if appropriate to do it for that alone though.

Hi Meddler! Thank you for joining us. I appreciate it & I want to ask your consideration on changing the term, "Grounded." I definitely think it should be changed as I feel we can do much better.

My ideas:

Stagger
Paralyze
Hamstring
Disable
Stall

Stagger is my personal favorite though I believe
Disable or Stall to best convey this particular impairment (impair is a decent one too).

Which do you like best from my list? Please pick one!

I will add... I also feel the mechanic needs tweaking.

I don't think it should prevent 'magic-based' movement (e.g. blinks/flashes/teleports), only dashes... it's just non-sensical that way ("let me silence your magic, but only the transportative kind"). Gameplay-wise, fantasy-realism aside, I think it'd be better too.

I also feel it should stop dashes in their tracks. Or if unwilling, please ensure the duration of the Staggering Effect doesn't begin until the dash has expired (if cast during).

I like how it applies a minor slow, though. I think that's perfect.

What do you think, Meddler?!

We talked through a long list of terms, those included. So far Grounded's the one we're happiest with, in terms of conveying what specifically it applies against (movement, but not basic right click movement). Terms like Stagger, Paralyze, Disable and Stall all imply CC, but are pretty general (could all be alternate names for 'Stun'). Hamstring's pretty good, ties really clearly to movement, it's very physical though and carries more thematic expecations and in  this case a widely applicable term's useful.

Grounded stops all movement effects in part so it's not too Feast or Famine. Applying it solely to physical feeling effects both introduces some loss of clarity (are Talon or Ezreal affected or not?) and makes it much less applicable in many games. Ability to lock out Flash in particular by contrast gives a baseline level of contribution (and slightly encourages use of other Summoner Spells on champions they're almost good choices on if facing a Cass or other champion with a similar effect).

As far as stopping dashes in progress goes so far we're targeting Grounded as a more pre-emptive effect, rather than an interrupt. Possible that might change, we do have a lot of abilities already that interrupt dashes though (every knockup and knockback for starters).
Hamstring could be nice for another spell preventing self-speedups.

Maybe excluding item passives, but including actives?

The problem with displacements being all that interrupts dashes is that displacements are just too good. They stop dashes AND don't get reduced by tenacity, making them VERY strong. Meanwhile other ccs have neither of these strengths.
And they tend to be around 0.5s in duration, in contrast with the 1-2s of other non slow CCs.

But then comes Morgana with the 4 second root... NOT THAT I"M COMPLAINING! Well, I kind of am, but she also feels balanced to play against so...
This was rather a waste of text characters I do believe.
You mean the 2 to 3 second root (depends on spell rank). :p

Yes I do, just played a game with her and I remembered the root increased with rank, but I thought it was 3-4 seconds not 2-3.
*Wth Rito, that's her main ability, make it last longer so I can bitch more!*

And yet they tend to come with slows attached... Or post knock up stuns. Or they're targeted. Or they're on a low cd with no resource cost. Or they _do_ in fact last 1 second or even _longer_. And some of them are on champs with rather high pick rates.

In fact I just looked at a large number of random champions with displacements and found that the majority of the displacements with a set duration last 1 second, particularly knock ups. Unfortunately we don't have numbers for the durations for some of the shorter ones like Orianna's R, which I think is due to the duration varying based on location of the spell and the champions hit. However there are also ones with longer duartions that constantly vary like Gragas' R as well.

Here's a list of champions I checked who have displacements that can last 1 or more seconds. This certainly isn't a complete list.

{{champion:12}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:154}} 

I'm starting to think the majority of displacements actually last 1 second or more... Though the cost and cd of such effects is of course also a factor because that in part decides the frequency at which they occur.

Do non displacing, non purely slowing CCs last even longer on average? I don't feel like checking but I'd say probably yeah. But not stopping dashes and blinks also causes those CCs to be largely or entirely wasted quite often. As a Morgana main I can't even begin to convey how common it is for me to hit someone with her Q but have it not matter at all because they still go over the wall, behind the minions, or at the very least out of my W before being unable to move.

Singed is one of those old champs (like Cassiopia I guess) that really struggles in the dash meta, playing against champions like Kallista and Kindred can be quite a frustrating experience (since they posses both spam able dashes and slows).

This would also give Singed some play potential where sadly his Fling-adhesive combo doesn't do the trick (think I've managed it twice since it was added, and seen it pulled of a hand full of times). Since the cast times are to long to combo and once on the ground it is to unpredictable to try to fling to it, it mostly feels like luck when it happens.

Currently when chasing a dash able champion it is often better not to use adhesive since it has such a long cast time that Singed loses more time casting it than enemies do dashing out of it.
